column3: This bug was not introduced when switching to deleteLater.\nTry testing the commit directly before that.\n
@laanwj I assumed that was the case, because I remember during my sendcoins changes I verified that I can't delete the last entry. Anyway, do you just want me to remove the description ;)?\n

I just want to be sure that we know the correct cause of the behavior change.
I remember that I also noticed this behavior back when I changed it to deleteLater and then tested the previous version and the behavior was already there.
It could be  that I made a git mistake though...

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/24646ee76f060a4590d074e80aebeb6665cb5ae1 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

I think this can be improved further by adding a entry->hide() here.

With this patch it looks like there are two entries for a very slight moment.
That is a great suggestion, I'll update the pull... updated!\n
